授業目的: This course examines current issues of conflict between secular society and religion in liberal democracies around the world. Through this course, students are encouraged to reflect critically on the meaning of such key concepts as religious freedom, secularism, and multiculturalism.
到達目標: After taking this course students will gain a general understanding of ongoing debates on the relation between religion and society in liberal democracies around the world. They will also become familiar with relevant concepts and theories.
特記事項:
この科目は、10/10（月）までの授業がオンデマンドで実施される科目です。
10/11（火）以降の授業は対面での実施が決定しました。本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course will be offered on-demand until 10/10（Mon.）.
Classes will be held in a face-to-face format from Monday, 10/11（Tue.） onward.
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法: Classes 1-3 will be available on demand. This course adopts a “reversed classroom” format. Classes will consist of student presentations and discussion. There will be no regular hour-long lectures except occasional mini ones as appropriate.
